name: treatment of refractory spent pot liner from Al electrolysis, residual material landfill | refractory spent pot liner from Al electrolysis | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/28055/documentation

This dataset represents the activity of waste disposal of 'refractory spent pot liner from Al electrolysis' in a residual material landfill (RMLF). Recommended use of this dataset: The waste is the ceramic part (second cut) of a used pot lining (spent pot lining SPL) which is the carbon-ceramic composite used as cathode container in aluminium electrolysis from bauxite.  Inventoried waste consists of fraction: 100% spent pot liner, refractory fraction; .  Waste composition (wet, in ppmw): H2O na; O 392510; H na; C na; S na; N 330.12; P 80.218; B na; Cl 399.4; Br na; F 85871; I na; Ag na; As na; Ba na; Cd na; Co na; Cr na; Cu na; Hg na; Mn 77.317; Mo na; Ni na; Pb na; Sb na; Se na; Sn na; V na; Zn na; Be na; Sc na; Sr 369.22; Ti 359.16; Tl na; W na; Si 172740; Fe 12568; Ca 39255; Al 195590; K 2486.7; Mg na; Na 97853.  Share of carbon in initial waste input that is biogenic 61.4%.  Additional solidification of residues with 0.4 kg of cement.

The activity starts with the waste being available at the gate of the treatment facility. Collection and transportation of the waste to the treatment plant is not included.

The activity ends with the waste being treated and waste-specific emissions from the landfill are released to water (short-term emissions to water from leachate and long-term emissions to ground water). Expenditures for solidificalion with cement are also included.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3822:Treatment and disposal of hazardous waste

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset represents a landfill site with mean annual temperature (MAT) of 6.5 degC, mean annual precipitation (MAP) of 920 mm/year, mean annual actual evaporation (EAT) of 326 mm/year, and net infiltration of 594 mm/year. Temperature at site can result in permafrost conditions, which slows down water flow by a factor of 0.998. The leachate percolating through the residual material landfill has an average residence time of 5.9 years.;Reference for climatic parameters:;World Bank, 2022. Average precipitation in depth (mm per year), World Bank Group Available at: https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/AG.LND.PRCP.MM?end=2019&start=2019;Environment Canada. Meteorological Service of Canada. Canadian Climate Normal Available at:https://climate.weather.gc.ca/climate_normals/index_e.html
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Residual material landfill for polluted, inorganic waste (VVEA Type C). With base seal and leachate collection system. Ultimate average landfill height is 10 meters. Operation phase duration is 30 years. Recultivation after closure. Additional solidification with cement requested. Based on average waste composition and climate data the end of carbonate phase in the residual material landfill is estimated to be reached after 60 000 years.
